sn12.20:1.2: “Mendicants, I will teach you dependent origination and dependently originated phenomena.
sn12.20:1.3: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
sn12.20:2.2: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death.
sn12.20:2.3: Whether Realized Ones arise or not, this law of nature persists, this regularity of natural principles, this invariance of natural principles, specific conditionality.
sn12.20:2.4: A Realized One understands this and comprehends it,
sn12.20:2.5: then he explains, teaches, asserts, establishes, clarifies, analyzes, and reveals it.
sn12.20:2.7: ‘Rebirth is a condition for old age and death.’
sn12.20:3.1: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth …
sn12.20:3.2: Grasping is a condition for continued existence …
sn12.20:3.3: Craving is a condition for grasping …
sn12.20:3.4: Feeling is a condition for craving …
sn12.20:3.5: Contact is a condition for feeling …
sn12.20:3.6: The six sense fields are a condition for contact …
sn12.20:3.7: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields …
sn12.20:3.8: Consciousness is a condition for name and form …
sn12.20:3.9: Choices are a condition for consciousness …
sn12.20:3.10: Ignorance is a condition for choices.
sn12.20:3.11: Whether Realized Ones arise or not, this law of nature persists, this regularity of natural principles, this invariance of natural principles, specific conditionality.
sn12.20:3.12: A Realized One understands this and comprehends it,
sn12.20:3.13: then he explains, teaches, asserts, establishes, clarifies, analyzes, and reveals it.
sn12.20:3.16: So the fact that this is real, not unreal, not otherwise; the specific conditionality of it:
sn12.20:4.1: And what are the dependently originated phenomena?
sn12.20:4.2: Old age and death are impermanent, conditioned, dependently originated, liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
sn12.20:4.13: Ignorance is impermanent, conditioned, dependently originated, liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
sn12.20:4.14: These are called the dependently originated phenomena.
sn12.20:5.1: When a noble disciple has clearly seen with right wisdom this dependent origination and these dependently originated phenomena as they are, it’s impossible for them to turn back to the past, thinking:
sn12.20:5.2: ‘Did I exist in the past? Did I not exist in the past? What was I in the past? How was I in the past? After being what, what did I become in the past?’
sn12.20:5.3: Or to turn forward to the future, thinking:
sn12.20:5.4: ‘Will I exist in the future? Will I not exist in the future? What will I be in the future? How will I be in the future? After being what, what will I become in the future?’
sn12.20:5.5: Or to be undecided about the present, thinking:
sn12.20:5.6: ‘Am I? Am I not? What am I? How am I? This sentient being—where did it come from? And where will it go?’
sn12.20:5.9: Because that noble disciple has clearly seen with right wisdom this dependent origination and these dependently originated phenomena as they are.”
